availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, stonemason. Maryland native. Married to Martha Patsy Cord Doyle on April 10, 1811. Father of Mileah Doyle, Mary Doyle, Joseph Doyle, Matilda Doyle, Priscilla Doyle, David Doyle, and Mila Doyle. Stonemason in Fleming County in 1850 and 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 339. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 2, p. 6. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Poplar Plains, p. 35. Elizabeth Prather Ellsberry, comp., Marriage Records of Fleming County, Kentucky, 1798-1851 (Chillicothe, MO: Elizabeth Prather Ellsberry, c1965), 1811 (accessed via Ancestry). Yates Publishing, U.S. and International Marriage Records, 1560-1900, Ancestry, Fleming County, Kentucky, 1811.
